==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ば|か|yomi=j}}

===Etymology===
Possibly a transcription of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=はか'}} {{m|sa|मोह|tr=moha||[[folly]]}}, used as a slang term among monks<ref>{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref>{{R:Kojien}}</ref><ref>{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>. Alternately, arising from the same root as {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はか'}} {{m|ja|痴|tr=woko</i>, modern <i>oko||stupidity, ridiculousness}}, also sometimes used as [[ateji]] for {{cog|sa|मोह|tr=moha}}.

The kanji are {{ateji|sort=はか'}}. The kana spelling ({{ja-l|バカ}}) is more common.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|y=j|ばか|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}
